org.eclipse.keyple.calypso.transaction

Class PoSecureSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.calypso.transaction.PoSecureSession

  • public class PoSecureSession
extends java.lang.Object
    Portable Object Secure Session. A non-encrypted secure session with a Calypso PO requires the management of two ProxyReader in order to communicate with both a Calypso PO and a CSM

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PoSecureSession.CsmSettings
      List of CSM settings keys that can be provided when the secure session is created.
      static class  PoSecureSession.SessionAccessLevel
      The PO Transaction Access Level: personalization, loading or debiting.
      static class  PoSecureSession.SessionState
      The PO Transaction State defined with the elements: ‘IOError’, ‘SEInserted’ and ‘SERemoval’.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PoSecureSession

        public PoSecureSession(org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.ProxyReader poReader,
                       org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.ProxyReader csmReader,
                       java.util.EnumMap<PoSecureSession.CsmSettings,java.lang.Byte> csmSetting)
        Instantiates a new po plain secure session.
        • Logical channels with PO & CSM could already be established or not.
        • A list of CSM parameters is provided as en EnumMap.
        Parameters:
        poReader - the PO reader
        csmReader - the SAM reader
        csmSetting - a list of CSM related parameters. In the case this parameter is null, default parameters are applied. The available setting keys are defined in PoSecureSession.CsmSettings

    • Method Detail

      • processOpening

        public org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.SeResponse processOpening(org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.ApduResponse poFciData,
                                                            PoSecureSession.SessionAccessLevel accessLevel,
                                                            byte openingSfiToSelect,
                                                            byte openingRecordNumberToRead,
                                                            java.util.List<PoSendableInSession> poCommandsInsideSession)
                                                     throws org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.IOReaderException
        Open a Secure Session.
        • The PO must have been previously selected, so a logical channel with the PO application must be already active.
        • The PO serial & revision are identified from FCI data.
        • A first request is sent to the CSM session reader.
          • In case not logical channel is active with the CSM, a channel is open.
          • Then a Select Diversifier (with the PO serial) & a Get Challenge are automatically operated. The CSM challenge is recovered.
        • The PO Open Session command is built according to the PO revision, the CSM challenge, the keyIndex, and openingSfiToSelect / openingRecordNumberToRead.
        • Next the PO reader is requested:
          • for the current selected PO AID, with keepChannelOpen set at true,
          • and some PO Apdu Requests including at least the Open Session command and optionally some PO command to operate inside the session.
        • The session PO keyset reference is identified from the PO Open Session response, the PO challenge is recovered too.
        • According to the PO responses of Open Session and the PO commands sent inside the session, a "cache" of CSM commands is filled with the corresponding Digest Init & Digest Update commands.
        • Returns the corresponding PO SeResponse (for openCommand and poCommandsInsideSession).
        Parameters:
        poFciData - the po response to the application selection (FCI)
        accessLevel - access level of the session (personalization, load or debit).
        openingSfiToSelect - SFI of the file to select (0 means no file to select)
        openingRecordNumberToRead - number of the record to read
        poCommandsInsideSession - the po commands inside session
        Returns:
        SeResponse response to all executed commands including the self generated "Open Secure Session" command
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.IOReaderException - the IO reader exception

      • processPoCommands

        public org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.SeResponse processPoCommands(java.util.List<PoSendableInSession> poCommands)
                                                        throws org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.IOReaderException
        Process PO commands in a Secure Session.
        • On the PO reader, generates a SeRequest for the current selected AID, with keepChannelOpen set at true, and ApduRequests with the PO commands.
        • In case the secure session is active, the "cache" of CSM commands is completed with the corresponding Digest Update commands.
        • Returns the corresponding PO SeResponse.
        Parameters:
        poCommands - the po commands inside session
        Returns:
        SeResponse all responses to the provided commands
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.IOReaderException - IO Reader exception

      • processCsmCommands

        public org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.SeResponse processCsmCommands(java.util.List<CsmSendableInSession> csmCommands)
                                                         throws org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.IOReaderException
        Process CSM commands.
        • On the CSM reader, transmission of a SeRequest with keepChannelOpen set at true.
        • Returns the corresponding CSM SeResponse.
        Parameters:
        csmCommands - a list of commands to sent to the CSM
        Returns:
        SeResponse all csm responses
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.IOReaderException - if a reader error occurs

      • processClosing

        public org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.SeResponse processClosing(java.util.List<PoModificationCommand> poModificationCommands,
                                                            java.util.List<org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.ApduResponse> poAnticipatedResponses,
                                                            PoCommandBuilder ratificationCommand,
                                                            boolean closeSeChannel)
                                                     throws org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.IOReaderException
        Close the Secure Session.
        • The CSM cache is completed with the Digest Update commands related to the new PO commands to send and their anticipated responses. A Digest Close command is also added to the CSM cache.
        • On the CSM session reader, a SeRequest is transmitted with CSM commands of the cache. The CSM cache is emptied.
        • The CSM certificate is recovered from the Digest Close response. The terminal signature is identified.
        • Next on the PO reader, a SeRequest is transmitted for the current selected AID, with keepChannelOpen set at the reverse value of closeSeChannel, and apduRequests including the new PO commands to send in the session, a Close Session command (defined with the CSM certificate), and optionally a ratificationCommand.
          • If a PO ratification command is present, the PO Close Secure Session command is defined to set the PO as non ratified.
          • Otherwise, the PO Close Secure Session command is defined to directly set the PO as ratified.
        • The PO responses of the poModificationCommands are compared with the poAnticipatedResponses. The PO signature is identified from the PO Close Session response.
        • The PO certificate is recovered from the Close Session response. The card signature is identified.
        • Finally, on the CSM session reader, a Digest Authenticate is automatically operated in order to verify the PO signature.
        • Returns the corresponding PO SeResponse.
        Parameters:
        poModificationCommands - a list of commands that can modify the PO memory content
        poAnticipatedResponses - The anticipated PO response in the sessions
        ratificationCommand - the ratification command
        closeSeChannel - if true the SE channel of the po reader is closed after the last command
        Returns:
        SeResponse close session response
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.IOReaderException - the IO reader exception

      • computePoRevision

        public static PoRevision computePoRevision(byte applicationTypeByte)
        Determine the PO revision from the application type byte:
        • if %1-------  →  CLAP  →  REV3.1
        • if %00101---  →  REV3.2
        • if %00100---  →  REV3.1
        • otherwise  →  REV2.4
        Parameters:
        applicationTypeByte - the application type byte from FCI
        Returns:
        the PO revision

      • getRevision

        public PoRevision getRevision()
        Gets the PO Revision.
        Returns:
        the PoPlainSecureSession_OLD.poRevision

      • isSuccessful

        public boolean isSuccessful()
        Get the Secure Session Status.
        • To check the result of a closed secure session, returns true if the CSM Digest Authenticate is successful.
        Returns:
        the PoSecureSession.transactionResult
